Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kim062
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room located on the ground floor. While the room was small, it was adequate for one person and slightly bigger than I had expected after reading reviews of this hotel. It is a typical size for a London hotel. The room was very basic- no tea/coffee making facilities, but was clean and tidy and included a new LCD TV. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The shower water pressure was good and the bathroom clean and compact. Reception fairly helpful and overall stay was satisfactory. Quite good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant water-pressure in the shower!”
Reviews.Author: Lallilallilalli
Reviews.Content: As promised rooms and beds are very small. Positive surprises included cleanliness of bathroom and sheets (cant say the same for the floor of the room) as well as absolutely brilliant water pressure in the shower. It was also nice and warm, which might not be so enjoyable for people who prefer to sleep in cool temperatures. Negative aspects included an overall stench of cat-urine rising from the sewers as well as some flies buzzing around... overall not bad and location is definitely the whole point of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: visitor_venezuela
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room, quite tiny but ok. The location is excellent. Staff was not really helpful;

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: JonathanWoodruff
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice looking from the outside. It was a shame the same couldn't be said for the inside! The Reception area was nice enough but the corridors and rooms resembled being on board a ship in the crews quarters. The corridors were dark and dingy and the room wasn't clean, cobwebs all over the place and those horrible blue lights they have outside shined right in through the bedroom window all night making for a terrible nights sleep. To top it off, the ceiling must have only been 2 inches deep as we could hear thumping around all night from the people upstairs and the old plywood door didn't do much to keep the noise from the corridor out either. The bathroom was dirty (so was the room) and at one point, I was seriously considering walking out in the middle of the night as this was one of the worse night's sleep I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: kristy c
Reviews.Content: We needed a basic room near King's Cross and found this hotel to be the best price in the area. However, after a few hours our heat didn't work, and all they could do was offer us an extra duvet and told us the manager would do something in the morning. It was horrible taking a shower or doing anything but lay in bed covered in blankets! We left early in the morning and didn't get to speak to a manager but we decided to stay there the following week. Because it was the weekend, the price had gone up and they only knocked off a few pounds to compensate for the week before. So the price ended up being more than our first stay and the heat barely worked in the new room!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for London”
Reviews.Author: rbbrno
Reviews.Content: Positives -kindly receptionist -good position by the Kings Cross station -free wifi working most of the time -quiet Negatives -small room with spiderwebs on the walls (and in the bathroom) -small bathroom with linoleum (no tile), was not possible to close the window completely

Reviews.Title: “An excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonshearer
Reviews.Content: This place is, by London standards, very cheap, but it's also good, clean, quiet and close to Kings Cross/St Pancras. The rooms are small and have no tea/coffee making facilities or even a chair, but the bathroom (also small) is adequate so I can't complain. It doesn't do breakfast, but the price differential to places which do is enough for you to buy what you want. And, the wifi works and is free. I've already booked for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price for excellent clean new rooms in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Carlholsch
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel the morning of my check-in and in doing so received a great discount. £130 for 3 nights in a single bedroom. Wasn't expecting too much but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel may not look like much on the outside (just an average looking older London hotel) but it turned out to be an excellent place. Fairly new rooms, lcd tv, extremely quick wifi all over the hotel, 24 hour reception. More than you could ask for the price. My single room came with a comfy double bed and a small but clean and good quality bathroom and shower. Much recommended to anyone wishing to stay in London in a great central location (2 mins walk to kings cross station) for a very low price... for the area anyway. Very happy

Reviews.Title: “rubbish hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Emma_I_1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as a stop over when going to Paris. We knew the room would be small and that was fine, though 'small' is a bit of an over exaggeration......miniscule would be more like it. The 'double' bed was no more than a large single, which isn't very helpful when one of you is 6'3" and it was so soft that we both work with back ache after a fitful few hours of sleep. The bathroom was vile, smelt of damp and the ceiling was covered in mold, as you can see by the picture. The shower didn't drain, it just pooled in the middle of the again miniscule shower room. It also looked like the thing would fall on your head in a second so we didn't go anywhere near it. I like two pillows and they only provided one each so I asked for another one at reception and was promptly told to come back in an hour because the girl behind the counter was far too busy to get one now! Nice customer service skills I thought! However, after a crap night's sleep, in a tiny bed, in a room which smelt of damp, in a hotel when staff who don't care about their customer's.....we did only have to walk for 5 minutes to get to St Pancras. Past several other budget hotels on the same road which looked much nicer from the outside!

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Timeless
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend have stayed in other hotels in this area this had to be the worst the room was nothing short of a prison cell in a basement noisy most of the night with the stairs right by it and doors banging in future shall pay extra £10 for more well known hotel chains near here

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: RachHYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wardonia for 2 nights last weekend, whilst on a pre christmas trip to London. All I was looking for when I booked was a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a good location. I was not disapointed, the rooms are small but are advertised as such, they are very clean and warm, and the shower was great. I would definatley stay here again, although I think 2-3 nights would be my limit as beds are smaller than standard, our double was more a three quarter, so a little cramped. The staff are friendly and the location is great for those coming in to kings cross, what more do you want.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but very good for the price, clean and excellent transport links”
Reviews.Author: draig_cymru
Reviews.Content: I've rated this hotel as Very Good based upon it's price. Was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Travelled with a colleague on business. Rooms are admittedly small - the bed was positioned in a recess between the shower room and the wall - so if you are over 6ft 2" your feet will be up against the wall! Shower room was very clean and modern though. There was a small TV, but didn't use it. It served our requirments for a few hours sleep. Why pay more when you can get a quiet, clean, safe, comfortable enough room that's only 300 yards away from King Cross? No breakfast - but plenty of places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joedono
Reviews.Content: This little hotel makes my trip to London a joy, visited 4 times over 2 years and never had a bad experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few hours sleep”
Reviews.Author: relaxandsightsee
Reviews.Content: The Wardonia is nothing special, it is cheap compared to many other hotels in the area and only a 5 minute walk from St Pancreas to catch the Eurostar. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom clean and the TV got reception. There are no lifts in this hotel and the stairs are quite narrow, I wouldn't fancy taking large suitcases to a room - luckily we just had carry on bags. There are plenty of options for dinner within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Hum4n_Traffic
Reviews.Content: Pros - as mentioned location here is a clear winner, not just to st. pancras/kings cross station (direct line to/from the airport) but to the undergrounds, fast food spots, restaurants, pubs, grocery store, money exchange, atm and even a laundromat all within a couple min. walk. - When the service was good it was great, very helpful depending on who you got and when you got them. It seems like it is run by a family or relatives who also looked after their children there so if you get one that's done the late shift with the kids, responses may be a little abrupt. - We had to have a box picked up by courier but they couldn't make it till the day after we left, the guy on reception at the time was only too happy to help. - Room was clean and quiet for the most part. We were on the street level so there were a few noisy club goers returning home some nights - free wifi is always great Cons - also as mentioned here, room is small, no big deal, ive stayed in smaller and you don't go on holidays to stay in a room! Bathroom was Japan-room-small but clean. The lack of any kind of night stand or table was a bit annoying but nothing a suitcase rummage market style wardrobe couldn't fix ;) - tea/coffee facilities would have been nice (but then theyd have to build somewhere to put it!) - On arrival, there was a person smoking at the front, we went inside and waited for someone to come to reception, a few min. later the smoker came in (obviously had to finish the ciggy). Reception staff arent in uniform so it might be difficult to work out who is who if you want to ask a quick question. -the biggest gripe I have is on our second last night it was rather cold so we decided turn on the heat... nothing. So we spoke to a woman at reception and the response was a steadfast "yea the heat is broken in that room, the repair guy isn't coming till next week". err... ok? could have told us that at check in and no "we'll move you to another room" or "would you like some blankets?". looks like someone had been on for 12hours, oh you guys! At the time of booking this place was the cheapest for what you got in this location so I wasn't expecting the best and it certainly isn't the worse. 4 dots, minus one for making me sleep in my softshell but plus one for helping us out with the excess baggage (:

Reviews.Title: “Extremely budget”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie05
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a room with a bed in to crash before taking the train somewhere then this hotel is ideally located to St Pancras with plenty of food outlets nearby. If you're staying more than one night then this hotel is probably not for you. Although spotlessly clean, the facilities are basic. There is no kettle, no hair dryer, no room to sit and chill out. Just a bed with worn out bedding and a rail to hang your clothes on. Flies were an issue in my room too but I coped. For £70 a night I would choose the travelodge just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1775
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It is just a few 100 metres from Kings Cross and St Pancras train stations. If you are going to stay here it might not be a bad idea to book a triple if there are two of you. We did and the suit cases fit on the other bed. so we had room to move around. The staff were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rambus
Reviews.Content: Main advantage of this hotel is that it is situated really close to King's cross and St. Pancras station that is huge transport hub where you can start quick travel to almost any sightseeing of London. Hotel's staff is friendly and competent. WiFi was free and unlimited so it was really useful. Disadvantages of this hotel were represented by very small rooms and small double bed, and companies of people who smoke and cry under hotel's windows at night. Also there were very thin windows so you'd better ask them about temperature in the room if you are going to visit them in cold time.

Reviews.Title: “Fly fest”
Reviews.Author: DSEK
Reviews.Content: Arrived in our room to the window wide open and flies buzzing around. Managed to get them out the room and finally got to sleep on the squeeky bed, which wasnt easy with all the noise coming from the corridors. Much to our surprise when we arrived back at the room the next night the window was wide open again and about 20 flies in the room. Have no idea why the cleaners leave the window open when you have your luggage/valuables in the room. Absolutely shocking. Great location but even that wouldnt be enough to make me stay here again. Rooms are tiny, as is the bathroom. Would rather pay extra for a semi decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: nenaqu
Reviews.Content: very basic budget hotel, but worth for it's location and what it offers. excellent location, (incredibly close to king's cross/st pancras station with many restaurants and food options in the neighbourhood), hotel was quiet inside and out, private bathroom facilities with good hot shower. for the 6 days i was there, i was able to get a good night sleep each night. sure, the room is small, but it's not something that the hotel tries to hide. the room sizes are right there on the hotel's website. and sure, there's no elevator, but if you're travelling with heavy luggage, who's fault is that?

Reviews.Title: “Not for solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: DCSouthport
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as a stop off on my way home from a holiday abroad. I had to lug my heavy suitcase up three flights of stairs (with a trailing cable on the first flight), only to find I had the minutest room I have ever known. There was a good shower, good TV, but there was absolutely nowhere to put anything. I had to use the little space left on the floor after bringing in my case. I don't expect much for £45, but this was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Montseta93
Reviews.Content: In fact, we stayed there in december 2009. The room was small and there was no closet. Fortunately we were given a a three-pax room and we put our suitcases on the single bed. The shower is just a hole on the bathroom floor with a plastic curtain, but it was clean. On the other side, the hotel is very well located in front of King's Cross / St. Pancras train station. It's budget accomodation, but it's quite good for the money it costs.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kaminski
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after trying to find a decent and reasonable price B&B in London. Most hotels are fully booked. I have never stayed here before and very nervous and skeptical about this hotel. However upon checking in all my fears are unfounded as the receptionist was very friendly and charming. The room was clean, tiny but clean. It serve the purpose as I am only staying for one night. After a long flight, all I need was a clean and comfortable bed to sleep in. This hotel gave me just that. For what I paid, I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, tiny, tiny room.....!”
Reviews.Author: Tzina F
Reviews.Content: The staff was kind and the location very good...but the room & the bed was TOO TINY !!! The size of the bed was extremely small (definitely not a double, as we booked) .... and finally, we had the same sheets for 7 days !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you know what you are in for”
Reviews.Author: Victor1234
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, just be absoultely sure about what to expect. After reading the hotel's website I knew the rooms were tiny and provided the bare minimum, but it turned out to be worse than I expected. The room was like a spartan cell, with extremely old and dirty carpets and curtains that don't go down well if you suffer allergies. The bathroom was so small that you could barely turn around in it. Every time you shower, the entire bathroom floor gets drenched. The old windows had cracks and gaps to the exterior so I can't imagine what it must be like in winter. The first day, after the room had been minimally cleaned, the rubbish was left behind. I thought it had just been a mistake but the second day the room wasn't even touched. I asked at reception if the rooms were cleaned everyday and the response was just one word - "usually". The staff at the hotel are unfriendly and just don't want to be bothered and certainly don't care about any problem you may raise. When you ask if you can leave your luggage somewhere, they tell you to put it in a room down the corridor which is unguarded and where anyone can just walk in and take their time in picking what they want to steal. The staircases are extremely narrow and steep, so if you get a room on the third floor you have to drag your luggae up any way you can. I also noticed that fire doors in the corridors didn't close properly, so I would raise concerns over safety in this place. In conclusion, if you absolutely want to stay in this area of London and are travelling on a very tight budget, I suppose you don't have much of a choice but to stay in a place like this. Personally, I would rather stay a bit further out in a place with decent transport connections where you can at least feel minimally comfortable, safe and secure, even if it is low cost and bleak.

Reviews.Title: “No bad but things went missing from room!”
Reviews.Author: steve_espana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week and the hotel itself was not bad. There is no lift and the rooms are very small but nevertheless the rooms are clean and the location is great, just 2 minutes walk from Kings Cross station. However... before the trip I had surgery and was given Tramadrol which is a very strong pain killer... and incidently accoring to the farmacist a drug that addicts take if they can´t get other "street" drugs. Strangly this drug went missing from my room. Other medications and items were not touched but this one drug went missing. I reported it to the hotel and they didn´t take me seriously. I explained that i was not accusing anyone but that maybe it had accidently been thrown in the bin and could they check. The response was that none of the cleaniers speak English and if I wanted to check the bins I would have to do so myself. That night I asked the night receptionish if she had any news. She didn´t but she was very helpful. I explained that I had seen the farmacist and that because of the nature of the drug he advised I called the police. I told the night lady that unless my drugs were returned to me I would call the police and ask them to drugs test the cleaner. Remarkably the following morning when I went to reception my drugs were waiting for me... So who knows what happened.... an accident leading to them being put in the bin and later retrieved... or an opportunist cleaner that bottled it when she realised the police may be called... I canñt say as I don´t know but all I can say is that if you stay here you should lock away your madication and other valuables... because if the cleaner isn´t a thief (and I am by no means saying she is), but she definately is very careless with what she thorws away!

Reviews.Title: “not bat at all”
Reviews.Author: Loku77
Reviews.Content: i staid in this hotel by my self, and it was rally good, the room was a bit on the small side but it was big enough for me, it was clean good shower, comfortable, free Wi-Fi very good location, staff are friendly and willing to help, i would stay again at Wardonia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot complain at the price paid”
Reviews.Author: ClovaTheWestie
Reviews.Content: It is difficult to write a review on the Wardonia as the location is superb and it offers great value for money but the rooms are just so small and basic. All areas of the hotel are very clean and tidy, the bedrooms and public areas and it had incredibly comfortable beds. I still cannot mark it higher than three stars though as the room, and especially the bathroom were so small spending more than one or two nights may have driven me a little mad. During my short stay i only saw one member of staff, a young lad on the reception and he was very helpful and friendly, willing to have a chat with the guests. He was a real credit to the hotel. Saying all that if i was looking for a cheap crash pad for the night and couldn't get a room at the Euston Travelodge i'd have no hesitation about booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: NationalParkHiker
Reviews.Content: Since we knew not to expect large rooms from the very frank information on their website, we were not surprised or particularly dissapointed with what we found at the Wardonia. It was as advertised. Rooms were just a little over 9 X 8 feet with two twin beds and an almost 3 X 6 foot bathroom. Just enough space but none to spare. The beds were comfortable. They had duvets instead of top sheets and blankets and there was no wash cloth in the bath, but all 4 of the hotels and the two B&Bs where we stayed in Europe were the same. Location is very close to St Pancras & Kings Cross train stations - about a block and a half from St. Pancras. No breakfast is offered but several restaurants/pubs are closeby. Free WiFi worked well. No elevators or AC but windows opened and weather in late May was not hot. Not bad for the price. At $117 it was the cheapest we found near St. Pancras. Reception staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what they offer in their web”
Reviews.Author: cbkr11
Reviews.Content: Small rooms for sure, that is what they advertise in their web even with blueprints. Clean bathroom , comfortable bed. Just be sure to get the upstairs rooms not the groundfloor or basement ones, kind of dark and muddy. Our´s , third floor, faced the St. Pancra´s towers. Plenty of stairs, no elevators. Friendly staff. Lugagge storage. To get the Eurostar is a magnificent location, just one block away, and the metro station King Cross. Plenty of coffee shops and pubs around. Quiet area. Perfect for low budget travelers, definitly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox size, but good value”
Reviews.Author: Heartshunter
Reviews.Content: We had to stay over for 3 nights, and wanted something close to King's Cross. It's about a 5 minute walk from the station which was perfect if you are lugging around heavy suitcases. The rooms are teeny tiny and if you are claustrophobic you should not stay here. That being said, the rooms are very clean, clean towels and bedding every day and you can't beat the location. Very good value for money for the location, recommended for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and spotless”
Reviews.Author: Turtle99_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in a double room with my husband for a weekend away. The hotel is in a great location, just 2 min walk from Kings Cross station and is very quiet for a good night sleep. We wanted somewhere cheap that did the job and this place did just that. The room and ensuite bathroom altough very small were absolutely spotless with crisp white bedding and towells changed daily. There is hardly any space around the room or the bathroom but great value at £60 per night, for the cleanliness and location. We would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “my son says absolutly rubbish ( a comment from a nine yr old )”
Reviews.Author: petergel
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks very good from outside, we asked for a ground floor room as my wife has mobility problems and the room was sort of on g/f but we had steps to go down to it. the room had no storage for the clothes the paint was coming away from the ceiling in the bathroom, the shower rail was rusty, the bedroom was supposed to be a triple the double bed was more like a 3/4 double and the single my feet were off the end of it. The bathroom you wouldnt be able to swing a cat in it and when you showered the water didnt drain away the area was totally drenched. Staff were very pleasent and location is close to main train stations.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good location. Just don't expect anything but the bare minimum.”
Reviews.Author: Goodheavens85
Reviews.Content: I booked at very much the last minute and was allocated one of the basement rooms. On walking in, it's actually quite funny how utterly barren the room is. A lick of paint and a bit of decoration and I'd imagine they could up their prices, but that's obviously not the objective here. It's not dirty, though, just ugly. The shower, while not a nice room, performed very well. Beds were Spartan, but modestly comfortable. Tv was miniscule, but had perfect reception and a fair few channels. The staff were, well, what you might expect - disinterested. To summerise, I gave this hotel 'average'. It has positives and negatives. If you literally want nothing more than somewhere to sleep and shower, it's reasonably priced in a great location. If you're looking for a magical or romantic (or even particularly nice) hotel experience, I sincerely recommend you give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not for the claustrophobic!”
Reviews.Author: mrksheep
Reviews.Content: London is famous for being expensive and very cramped. The latter in particular applied on our stay here. This is a cheap no-frills hotel (no complementary food or wi-fi). It was very clean and staff were polite. The bed was very comfortable indeed. Although comfortable, the room was very small. For two people it proved somewhat awkward. The bathroom was basically a wet room no bigger than a large cupboard. Having a shower was very awkward and not relaxing at all. Fortunately we only needed a place to sleep the night, we were out and about most of the time so this wasn't a huge issue. i would recommend this hotel for those on a budget but remember it is no-frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but really really tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Vivi38
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great because it's easy to get to Kings Cross St. Pancras (about 200 meters) which has trains directly to Gatwick airport. Also most of the underground lines stop at Kings Cross which make it easy to get around in London. The rooms were REALLY small. Around 1,6 meter wide and 3 meter long. This is a great hotel if you're not going to spend a lot of time in your room, however, if you would like to relax in the daytime in your room, this isn't the best choice. Quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place for a convenient, quiet, clean, short stay in London.”
Reviews.Author: e_cjohnson
Reviews.Content: Dec. 2, 2010 the European air system nearly shut down due to ice and snowstorms. We were able to deplane at Heathrow only after our flight home to Chicago had left. Tens of thousands of other travelers had been pouring into London all day looking for a place to stay, and we arrived in the City at 8 p.m. We had good fortune. Our airline was willing to allow us to stay over an additional night and to keep our 3 pieces of checked luggage for us, and an airline clerk suggested looking for a budget hotel near the St. Pancras train station. (The Eurostar starts there.) There were a number of B&B's and small hotels there, but they seemed to be all filled up. One kindly hotelier let my husband sit in their reception area with our carry-along bags while I searched further, sliding along the ice coated streets. At the end of the last block of lodgings, the Wardonia had a room for two nights at a very good rate, 60 BP. It was a very, very small room, but very clean, well heated, with good quality linens (although the towels were small). The bathroom was a closet-sized shower stall with sink and toilet, but there was plenty of very hot water. There was no space in the tiny room for a chair, but at that point we were happy just to have a place to stay. It was quiet, the hotel and the street were quiet, the staff was friendly and helpful. They do have slightly larger rooms, even triples, which allow more breathing space. They inform incoming guests that there is no breakfast provided, but that was not a problem. The location was great, we were able to use the tube and buses easily. There are restaurants and coffee shops in the area, and tiny shops for necessities and for internet access. It is very, very close to the British Library, and within a half hour's walking distance to the British Museum. If we come to London on a planned trip, we would be willing to stay in a slightly larger room for several days.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Cash Machine !”
Reviews.Author: Pitchoone
Reviews.Content: I was travelling back to France from the english south coast during that famous week when the snow paralised a large part of the country. I booked that hotel but at last wasn't really sure I would be able to travel to London due to the weather, so I called the hotel to cancel, but the manager himself said it was impossible without paying the entire price for that night even if he was sure to sell it again ! So to resume, he told me that he will be glad to sell that room twice if I really wanted to cancel it !! What a businessman ! Where is the customer care then ...???

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Santicolombatto
Reviews.Content: Really clean. Concordance between the price and the quality. Very polite the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Squidhead
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel. I was in a tiny room at the top of the hotel but I knew what to expect, a clean quiet room with TV, in an excellent location in a quiet area near Kings Cross. I think it's one of the best values in London. No wifi but there's free wifi at McDonalds down the street.

Reviews.Title: “awful awful awful”
Reviews.Author: darren80_10
Reviews.Content: stayed her for one night and the attitude of the cleaning , front desk satff was nothing short of appalling.. check out was at 11am ..and it was 11.04 and the housekeeper came up and banged upon our door screamed and shouted your are late hurry up and check out whilst waving her finger at us.. when we spoke to the reception they emplied that were are lying and that they have never had complaint before which after looking onto trip advisor we saw that was lies .. this hotel is awful , room were dirty &smelly staff were rude and very unhelpful ..i will never use this hotel again .. and for all of you reading this .. please save yourself the money and the stress..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, basic and cheap accommodation”
Reviews.Author: RockDoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wardonia for one night in September 2010. After arriving at St Pancras on Eurostar, the hotel was literally less than 5mins walk away. The street is nice and we felt safe in the area late at night. Check in was friendly and our room was pleasant, in the main part of the hotel with views along the street to St Pancras. The room was exactly as (very honestly) described on their website - small, basic with tiny bathroom. For an overnight stay, it was fine but wouldn't be great for longer stays or if you had heaps of luggage to store. On checking out, we could store our bags with no worries and reception staff were always friendly, greeting us every time we came in or went out. No complaints here at this budget level in London.

Reviews.Title: “Got their basement room”
Reviews.Author: psoni
Reviews.Content: I got the basement room which is like staying in storage or attic in some sense. On the flip side, it is much better than staying in tiny hostels in the neighborhood. The best thing is that it is block away from King Cross & Euston train station. Perfect for international/local/tube trains.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ry101
Reviews.Content: I was aware that this was budget accomodation so I was expecting basic. I was not expecting a damp, mouldly and dirty room. When we arrived we were checked into a damp basement room. As an asthma sufferer this was most distressing. I asked to change rooms and was told that none were available. The receptionist was most unhelpful simply saying that the hotel had problems and there was nothing to be done. The bathroom was basic and the shower new but the tiling was dirty. I don't expect to have to buy airfreshener and anti-bacterial wipes when staying in a hotel. I understand that 'you get what you pay for' but this was not 'budget' it was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stay out of the basement rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sandy186383
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was reccommended by a friend, I would have to assume that they did not get a room in the basement. The first room was unexceptable, and we were offered a second room...still in the basement.....the window did not open, the odor in the room was quite unpleasant, only one ceiling light, in general the room was sparsley furnished (no bedside tables, nothing on the walls) not even a hook to hang your towel on in the bathroom....it is close to the train station but there are other hotels nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for London standards”
Reviews.Author: Srubka
Reviews.Content: Room are tiny but relatively clean.It is in Kings Cross so not necessarily central location but with a very good access to all attractions. Pancras station is 2 minutes walk away making it easy to get e.g. capitol city train from Gatwick Airport which is a cheaper than Gatwick express and takes you directly to the airport. All together i think it was a good value considering that the locations in London are not the cheapest in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Eurostar at St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: dorothySWEngland
Reviews.Content: We chose this budget hotel for it's location to St Pancras, as we had and early morning train to catch. It was easy to find, and apart from the lack of elevator (we were on the 4th floor), we had no complaints. Having read the hotel info, we were expecting a tiny room/bathroom and were actually suprised by the amount of room we had - perfectly adequate for a one night stay. The shower was very good, and the beds, although small were extremely comfortable with duvets. There are no breakfast facilities at this hotel, but we found several options at the stations, and there were other food outlets close by. The hallways and stairwells were a bit shabby and could have done with an update, but we would be happy to stay here again. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_Bergen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room with my wife. I say it is perfect for a short stay because the room and the bathroom are so small that you have no space to put your things anyhwere. But, provided you dont need to put stuff in the bathroom or open a big luggage in the room, this is perfect!! I have been in London several times, and for this value I never been to such a neat and clean place. I ws pleasantly surprised. It seems recently renewed, all in very good condition, nice. Comfortable bed and nice sheets. Very nice bathroom. All perfectly clean. The location is good. We didnt need much service, so we dont know much... but check in and out was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “A great budget option”
Reviews.Author: MrsBelrose
Reviews.Content: I chose Wardonia Hotel because of it's location close to Kings Cross Station and the main underground line for Heathrow but it's also well located for central London. The rooms are tiny but clean, a similar set-up to EasyHotel except you don't get charged for the extras. No lift so you have to be prepared to walk up several flights of stairs. Breakfasts are not offered but there are plenty of places nearby to get something to eat. I was in a single room and the bed was not particularly comfortable but for a one night stay it's fine, especially at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small and basic yet comfortable and clean.....what else do you want?”
Reviews.Author: KLSStaffordshire
Reviews.Content: Value for money if on a budget. Excellent location for Kings Cross and St Pancras and only a 15 minute walk from Euston. I did not experience any noise whilst staying at the hotel, it was very quiet and I slept well with the window open all night. Clean room with clean bedding. Friendly staff. Small room as advertised on the hotels website with the actual sizes so I didn't have expectations of a large room anyway. Would definitely stay again. I stayed for one night with my 6 year old son and it was a great base to sleep if your out in the day to explore London. If you want more space and luxuries or staying for more than 2 nights then book somewhere more expensive......but this hotel served the purpose for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best London hotel in its price range”
Reviews.Author: CheeseTraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few London budget hotels.Someone who has never stayed in a budget London hotel would be shocked by the humorously small bed, the lack of real wardrobe, the lack of separation between the shower and the rest of the shower room/toilet, etc. _But_ the Wardonia is clean enough (I knew better than to look too closely), it's quiet, the staff are friendly, and it's walking distance from St Pancras/King's Cross, the British Library and the British Museum. They have everything you actually need for an overnight stay--about 5 hangers, a bed with clean linens, en-suite, a towel, a window, curtains, and even a television. It also has a luggage room downstairs where you can leave your non-valuables while you see London. And it's cheap. Unless you're willing to fork out probably twice the money, I'd say you can't do better than that. One warning--like a lot of London there is no air conditioning, so it could possibly get pretty hot in the hot parts of the summer, but it was perfect in May.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very good”
Reviews.Author: Natali07
Reviews.Content: If you only want a good bed and a shower in a clean environment, this is the hotel you are looking for. Perfect location if arriving by eurostar. Nearby different underground lines. Very good matrass. Bathroom is small, sink is small too but good enough for us. No breakfast opportunity but there are plenty of possibilities nearby. We booked a triple room for the two of us as I was afraid that the room would be too small. It suited us fine, the 2 single beds could be moved towards each other. No noise from other rooms at all. We both slept very good. We will definitively go back to this hotel next time we are in London.

Reviews.Title: “A place to lay your head down”
Reviews.Author: dave2564
Reviews.Content: Upon reading the other reviews of the Wardonia on this site, I was in two minds on wether to book or not. However it was well priced, in an area of London I knew and would serve the purpose I required. So I booked a single room for 2 nights at the price of £45 a night. I was attending the World Wrestling Entertainment shows at the 02 Arena (which is a piece of cake to get to from this location - just need to do your homework!) Was greeted on arrival by a receptionist with a child. I thought this a tad bit of an inappropiate setting for a child but she still carried out her duties nice and politely so I wavered that. As you know by now, these rooms are small. I can and will clarify that. If your the type of person who likes to do press ups in the morning, forget it. If, like me, you just want a bed to lay down in and a shower to freshen up in, perfect. I could not fault the room one bit. I'm not the type to go around looking for faults anyway, and if any came to my attention I would mention them. But this room had everything I needed. A good TV, nice powerful shower and a decent view. One objection I did have was having to leave my key at reception everytime I left. I've never had to do this in any other hotel I've stayed in (thats a lot!). So I found it uncomfortable doing so but never the less everything in my room was still there upon returning, even after housekeeping had been in. Checking out was easy and swift, and the added bonus of a free left luggage room was a nice touch. Granted it wasn't locked though so anyone could access it. Keep that in mind. All in all, a great stay from me. I'll probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, comfortable and superb location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireboy40
Reviews.Content: A simple, clean, well situated London hotel. You couldn't beat this for value if you need central London location. Freshly laundered bedding, clean room, - no major style awards are gonna be won here, true, but the paintwork was clean and I had a nice comfortable sleep. I always stay here if I need a night for under £50 in central London. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “For a cheap break it fits the bill!!”
Reviews.Author: Badgerdogthefrog
Reviews.Content: For £60 a night in the city centre- with excellent access to all the tourist attractions via Kings Cross- its great value! Rooms are very small but clean with maid service and fresh towels every day! 2mins walk to Kings Cross and 10 min walk from Euston! The shower is good and the rooms are warm!! The bedroom and showers are very very small but for a cheap base in the city it does the job!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Liebez
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend in july 2009 with my boyfriend, we booked an ensuite double room and we had no problem whatsoever with this hotel. Room was normal sized, so was the toilet (some people may find it small but if you're used to british hotels you know it's just the way they are), all clean. I suggest this hotel to everyone, its basic but you get what you pay for: a cheap clean hostel with very good transportation service.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and outside construction, but a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TheJrock87
Reviews.Content: Triple rooms are tiny... tiny beds, tiny bathroom/shower (all together. STRANGE!) no room to do anything... Small TV with like 3 stations... but not bad for the 4 nights we were there. Staff is friendly.. Lots of local drunks walking around, also

Reviews.Title: “Great for those who like tiny rooms and claustraphobic hallways!”
Reviews.Author: kickkme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wardonia Hotel for 2 nights in the middle of December. Stone's throw away from the King's Cross/St Pancras station so can't argue with the location. Also, the tiny room means that the heater works well. That ends the good part of the review. To get to your room we had to navigate through extremely narrow hallways and stairways. The room itself was extremely tiny, with just enough space for a small 'double' bed (more like a super-single), 2 suitcases and maybe a chihuahua, and that's all. Toilet was even smaller, you won't be able to clean your butt without damaging your elbows. Oh, there was a small TV. Yaay! The sheets were clean, although the bed itself was slanted and did not provide good sleep. Towels changed daily. Window pane and ledges were dirty. In fact, most of the room looked dirty except the bed due to the weird dirty-blue color scheme and the dull yellow lighting. We paid 60 pounds a night and I would recommend travellers to explore other accomodation options instead of Wardonia. It is worth it to pay an additional 10 pounds or so a night to stay at other hotels, and the quality is much better. If you insist on staying, don't expect a 'hotel', but expect an ensuite room at a lower-end hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but rooms/bathroom much too small”
Reviews.Author: princessleo
Reviews.Content: We had a triple share room. The room wasn't really big enough for 2 people, let alone 3. The bathroom was tiny & the shower drain didn't work properly so the bathroom flooded until we pulled the whole drain/plug out of the shower, which left a gaping hole in the floor. We nearly broke our backs having to lug suitcases up & down the many flights of stairs to our room (which got steeper the higher the floor) The main powerpoint in our room didn't work, which left us with having to continually swap 3 peoples phone & camera chargers in the one working powerpoint. On the up side, the hotel is very close to Kings Cross & St Pancras stations. We loved having a small pub right next door ( though this may not suit some people with the Sat night noise factor) The room was pretty clean and the staff were pleasant enough

Reviews.Title: “a fine establishment for the fashionably drunk”
Reviews.Author: brapbob
Reviews.Content: Our stay was spent in a compact cosy room, slightly warmer than desired but providing an excellent base temperature for spending the evening sweating out. More desirable than the average den, a television was provided but not tested as our entertainment was provided - a rich real-time audio/visual experience of atmosphere beyond the window, a fine example of some of King Cross' finest architecture and social investment programmes. The bathroom provided an array of clean surfaces (without being annoyingly greased like you find in so many public houses), and with tiling throughout and a drain in the corner, allowing us to fully relax through into the night - one oversight by the designers is perhaps the lack of barrier preventing fluids escaping into the bedroom. All in all a pleasant night, the polite and motivated staff having no quibble with us engaging with the local red light culture and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here .. you may as well stay in kings cross public loo!”
Reviews.Author: sally_marie_87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what it says on the tin.... yes it is small which we expected for the price however you would expect a hotel to be cleaner than a public toilet whatever the price you pay. I booked in here for a one night stay with a collegue, our experience was so bad we ended up leaving at 11pm to go to the nearest travel lodge!!!! When we checked in we were not given our keys until the owner had contacted the travel agency that our company had booked with just in case we dedided we wanted to stay the night for free, despite the fact that both the travel company and our company had provided him with payment details many times over the previous week. This meant we had to wait in the tiny small reception whilst he confirmed (for the umteenth time) the payment details with both our company and the travel agents. My collegue then had to change rooms as they had allocated her a room that had clearly been slept in and not cleaned with dirty sheets, rubbish and pill boxes on the floor and dirt all over the bathroom. She was then moved to another room that wasnt much better, this had snails and spiders on the wall and plaster was hanging off the wall. I would like to say that my room was better and that she could share with me, but it wasnt. Not only was there not enough room to swing a london alley cat, as soon as the window was shut in the room it smelt worse than a public toilet. The room smelt strongly of urine so bad that it hit the back of your throat when you breathed. Also the "clean towels" were grey, and the sheets had holes in them. Unfortunately... as we had just dropped off our cases and dashed out it was almost eleven oclock when we realised how bad the rooms were. You can live with a spider but i have never known a hotel to have snails on the wall or to smell worse than a public toilet. we then had to call to find somewhere else to stay and luckily was rescued by good old travellodge... this was only 5 mins down the road and for the extra ten pounds was far superior! When leaving the friendly receptionist told us we would have to pay for the room as there was nothing wrong with it. I would seriously never stop here again, and would advise that you look every possible other place before even considering here. Even a basic hotel should be free from creepy crawlies and should at least be clean. THERE WASNT EVEN A LAMP SO YOU COULD STAY UP ALL NIGHT READING IF YOU DIDNT DARE GO TO SLEEP!

Reviews.Title: “probably worth paying extra £15 for a better den...”
Reviews.Author: bazancik
Reviews.Content: Location is convenient, the bedding is clean -- but that's really it... Hotel is a grand name for this residential building. Bedding is fresh and clean - but the rest of the place not so much... To get to the room one has to go through a maze of narrow corridors with an overdue carpet (or was it intentional to make the place feel Victorian?) To find the right room look for a Post-it-Note stuck on the door instead of a number plate (they really are on the budget I guess!). Once you get into your room don't expect too much: it's small (just about enough to put your staff around and crash on the bed). Walls are beautified with both holes and some smears of "better not to investigate" origins. The shower cubicle is absolutely tiny (and I'm not a big guy!) and bringing a pair of flip-flops would help you to overcome the fear of stepping barefoot inside (see photos...). On the good side there is enough pressure and temperature in it! It's a cheap place and if was converted into a hotel in the cheapest possible way. You'll get a relatively clean place to stay (if walls and bathroom don't bother you too much). So if you gong for a couple of days for a training or business- you get a decent place to crash for a few hours before getting out again. It's not a place you want to stay in for pleasure. And definitely not for a romantic break!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and safe, with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: CaptainSK
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are very small, but for the location and price, you can't get any better than this. It's very close to several Tube and bus lines, and it's an easy, pleasant walk from many tourist destinations. My chief concerns for a home base were safety and cleanliness, and I was very satisfied on both counts. Rooms are cleaned daily, the shower had good water pressure, and the staff were congenial. Don't go expecting the Ritz and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and small”
Reviews.Author: Dusica_sydney
Reviews.Content: Although you feel like you need a can opener to get out of the bed in the morning, Wardonia offers a clean, convinient, and affordable stay in the busy town of London. Of course, they do advise you of the room size before you book (this is if you book though their webpage). There is nothing much more to say about this hotel other then the staff were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money !!!”
Reviews.Author: doggoneboy
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for 1 night. The price was about 55 pounds for a double ensuite room which is perfect in London and specially in this area. Just situated near king's cross where you can catch either a bus or the metro to get to Picadilly. We enjoyed our stay there, the hotel is very clean. The room was quite small but for one night we weren't looking for a big room and so on...

Reviews.Title: “very basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: linaloppa
Reviews.Content: My fiend overheard this conversation between a guest checking in and the staff: -Where is the breakfast served? -There are several great places for breakfast close by -Where are the lifts? -We have....stairs.... This was our second stay so we knew what we were in for. The best features of this hotel are the price, the cleanliness and the friendly staff. The rooms are very basic, no furniture except the beds and a small table attached to the wall. They have saved in on everything, even hooks or hangers in the bathroom and other lamps than the one in the ceiling. The location is very convenient if you travel by train, being close to both St Pancras and Euston station, and the underground from King's Cross takes you to most tourist attractions in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “BUDGET hotel, no AC or elevator in a great location”
Reviews.Author: keyspd
Reviews.Content: Paid GBP60 per night but unfortunately ended up being in London on 2 of their hottest days and the tiny room with windows wide open offered no comfort or sleep. Room was on the 2rd floor accessed via a narrow staircase, lugging our luggage up and down was a little annoying. The back ally was very noisy at night with drunks, music from other buildings, etc. Room was serviced each day. The location provides great access to Kings Cross/St Pancras. This is a budget hotel at best and a private, nice hostel at worst.

Reviews.Title: “very small, but clean”
Reviews.Author: sazzy1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It is in a brilliant location for st pancras international only 5 mins walk. I have to say the hotel room and ensuite was the smallest I've ever seen and don't think the bed was quite a double. However the tv worked fine, bedroom and bathroom were both very clean and shower worked fine. The first night was very noisey from the pub next door but the second night was quieter. We just wanted a cheap room for two nights and it served our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but Alhambra is better”
Reviews.Author: LRE_SF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is inexpensive & clean, but the Alhambra hotel just down the road is a much better deal. Wardonia does not have wifi, breakfast, or even a tea kettle in the room. The furniture & interiors all look nice and new/refurbished, but I didn't even have a water glass in the room! It's VERY basic. Alhambra has similar prices, with free breakfast & wifi, and tea & water glasses in the room. Also, at Wardonia you have to leave your key with the front desk when you go out, but Alhambra lets you keep your key and let yourself in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, friendly, cheap, no breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ralpharama
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just minutes from Kings Cross station, but down a calm, quiet and fairly pleasant street. The staff were helpful and friendly. There is no breakfast, but what do you expect for the price? Just get down to a local cafe in the morning, it still works out cheaper. It's a big old hotel with endless corridors, but was pretty quiet when I was there. Some of the top floor rooms have a great view of St Pancras Station. The room itself was very small! With a tiny bed and bathroom/shower. Also had TV with freeview. Very clean throughout - faultless in fact. Checkout was prompt and easy.

Reviews.Title: “I would never go back”
Reviews.Author: weddimooner
Reviews.Content: Perfect location (close to St Pancras station and King's Cross) but we left the hotel after one night due to condition of room (room on basement level, window facing the brickwall of basement, window broken, room in direct connection with street outside and no lock or fastening on the door - it was scary). I assume they have better rooms and we were simply unlucky with booking this specific room as the hotel was fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: corondale
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Wardonia as I was attending a converence just around the corner. Very short walk from Kings Cross station. I knew from previous reviews that the room would be small and it was but hey, I was only planning on sleeping there - the bed was comfortable, my window opened fully and over looked a quiet residential area (back of hotel rather than front) Appeared to have had new carpets through out the hotel. The bathroom and bedroom were clean and bed was remade the 2nd day which I wasnt expecting at all. Everyoine on reception was very friendly and one of the guys - who must have done something like an 18 hr shift as he was always there, rembered my room number everytime without me asking - gresat service.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - great location for travellers”
Reviews.Author: Dion_ZA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night (30 Apr). Rooms are tiny, but that is what you would expect from a budget hotel in this area – I’m 6”4 and I managed just fine.. Room and bathroom was very clean. Would think that an extended stay here would not be too great as there is not much space for suitcases or hanging up of clothes. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the entrance – we stayed above the entrance and were disturbed a number of times during the night by people coming / going. We had an early train out of St Pancras so we did not have b’fast at the hotel. It is a 3 – 4 min walk to the station from the hotel so the location was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “It met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CLTarheel
Reviews.Content: First of all, the reviewers complaining about the size of the rooms didn't do their research. We booked through the Wardonia website and they have the room sizes listed for everyone to see before booking. Yes the rooms are small, but we wanted somewhere close to the Kings Cross Station. We arrived late in Heathrow and left early the next morning on the Eurostar. The Russian girl who checked us in was helpful but more interested in her TV show. The room and bedding was clean. The bathroom was as described with water everywhere, just be sure to brush your teeth before your shower. :) Overall, it is a no frills hotel but they aren't misrepresenting themselves. We only spent one night here and would recommend it only as a one night stop unless you plan on being gone from the room ALL day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - budget hotel - clean room”
Reviews.Author: Cressida
Reviews.Content: Having read mixed reviews, I entered the hotel with some trepidation. Having only paid £45 for the night, I wasn't expecting much. The room was very small, but the bed was comfortable. There was also an en-suite 'wet-room' (which I wasn't expecting as I hadn't paid any extra), also small, but had everything I needed (no hospitality tray, but there is a Burger King on the same street). The hotel itself is about 4 minutes from Kings Cross and the I found the surrounding area surprisingly quiet. Any noise problem came from within the hotel (guests knocking on doors and you could hear people in the room above), but I managed to get a good night's sleep. Excellent value for money, clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: leBec
Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel experience at all at the Wardonia. I stayed there for three nights and it was a hotel experience that I wish to forget as soon as possible. I’ve stayed in 100´s of hotels and while this one may not have been the worst, certainly it belongs among the five worst. Really, the only redeeming quality about the Wardonia is it’s location in the lively King’s Cross area, which is not nearly enough. You can really tell the bottom of the barrel establishments such as the Wardonia from the more respectable hotels by the attitude of the staff and management towards the guests. The girls at the reception, who were Russian, were helpful enough. The real problem with the place seems to be with the people who run the place, who I think are Irish. The first shock was the smallness of the room. The room was en suite but you could not open the door to the bathroom properly because the bed was in the way. It was just plain cramped, like living in a closet. The second shock was the bathroom itself which was just tiny and when you took a shower the entire bathroom floor would within minutes become flooded because there was no partition separating the shower area from the rest of the bathroom. It also became quite comical that when I stepped in certain parts of the bathroom floor, simultaneously in other parts water would actually squirt up from the space in between the tiles in the floor, since the adhesive had worn off. The floor needed to be repaired, lol. The hotel was also very noisy. If you stay there, (which I hope you have the good sense not to) you’d better pray that the people in the neighbouring rooms choose to sleep at night, because every activity in one room can be heard by the neighbours because of the thin walls. One day I requested a new soap from the person at the reception (one of the people in management, I think) because the one in my room didn’t look fresh (something that I didn’t say to him). "But you already have a soap, sir." He responded, and he proceeded to start an argument over a 3 by 5 centimetre bar of soap. Obviously the old adage: "the customer is always right," meant nothing to him. Eventually, he gave me a new bar of soap and then he came with me into the room, took the old bar of soap from the bathroom and then he stuck it under my nose and said: "this bar has definitely not been used." I would, needless to say, not recommend the Wardonia to any fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Always clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: abc001
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Wardonia several times a week while working in London. Have done so for 4 months now. It's convenient for my office, but that is not the only reason for returning again and again. I have stayed in many different rooms there. All have been clean, warm enough, and with a comfortable bed. As I'm on my own and travel light the lack of space is not a problem - feeling comfortable and safe is the priority. Reception is manned by a rota of 4 or 5 friendly staff. A really good value for money, no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location; room so-so”
Reviews.Author: cattyabby
Reviews.Content: convenience was the sole reason why i chose this hotel. the room was really tiny and the bed was not comfortable and it was questionable as to whether the sheets were even clean - but i didn't expect much as it was only GBP40/night. i must say, the location was great as i had to take 550am eurostar and i wouldn't know how to get the king's cross otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but clean and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: JvB-Ehv
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located, a few minutes walking from the Eurostar station and in walking distance from downtown, St. Paul's and the Camden market. Facilities (shower/toilet) were basic, but clean and working well. The rooms are extremely small. No breakfast is available (not a real problem, because there is ample choice nearby). The main problem we had is that the twin bed was far too small. We changed to a room with double beds, then we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect cleanliness here”
Reviews.Author: cathandcraig
Reviews.Content: Aside from being impossibly small (which was expected), the level of cleanliness was far from acceptable. Sheets were covered in hair, as was the mattress when sheet was stripped. New sheets were supplied, but these were stained yellow and had holes. Staff apathetic. Was itchy in the bed, but no sign of bed bugs.... Size of bed was not a double. King single at most. My boyfriend's head hit the bed head, and his feet rested squarely on the wall at the foot of the bed. If you are over 6 feet tall, do not stay here - you will not fit! Reception changed 3 times in 2 hours - not sure how they can guarantee security of your belongings when this is their procedure. Needless to say, booked another hotel close by ASAP. Luckily, a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, No-Frills Digs”
Reviews.Author: jluo
Reviews.Content: I had an idea of what to expect from the Wardonia before booking it: a modest form of accommodations with few extras in the city center and for a relatively affordable price. Little did I realize that my room would be even more bare bones than I could have imagined. I already expected a desk and a chair to be absent. I also knew there would be no barrier separating the shower stall from the rest of the bathroom. (There was, however, an annoying squealing sound coming from the bathroom, the source of which I couldn't pinpoint, right after I used it. I reported this to one of the clerks on duty, but it didn't appear that anything was done about it.) But I didn't expect there to be no phone in the room (in case I had to contact the front desk). There was also no shampoo in the bathroom (just two bars of soap) and no kettle for boiling water. (The clerk was, however, nice enough to boil it for me with her own kettle.) There was a TV, which was about the only "luxury" in the room. Heat was provided 24 hours a day, which was just as well, since London had been gripped by sub-zero temperatures during my stay there. My bed was good for one person with a nice, big blanket. The room and bathroom were clean, as other guests have commented. The Wardonia is fine for any traveler who plans to spend only one night there and before hopping on a train at nearby King's Cross, St. Pancras, or Euston stations the next day. It is a little less adequate for travelers who plan to stay longer, as I did. The hotel is located on a quiet street that is lined with small hotels, and some of the other hotels provide a complimentary breakfast. I thought I would simply have breakfast at any of the restaurants located on Euston Rd., the main thoroughfare in the neighborhood, but they all served the same greasy slop that one would grow sick of after two tries, and usually at inflated prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: sarahld85
Reviews.Content: We booked the Wardonia as somewhere cheap to stop for New Years Eve. It only cost £60 which is good for London, especially consdering how close it was to Kings Cross Station. As stated in other reviews the rooms are small so probably only suitable it you haven't got much luggage or only staying for a couple of nights. The rooms were clean. There were a couple of bad points which means I would be reluctant to go back there again. Firstly everytime you left the hotel you had to leave the key for your room. When you go back all you have to say is your room number and you are given the key. Therefore anyone could go into your room, so not vey safe at all. Although the hotel is only a few minutes walk away from Kings Cross the street it is on is very quiet and there are some dodgy characters around. It did not feel very safe. Overall rooms are adaquete and clean. However not a very secure hotel and not a great area.

Reviews.Title: “OK! :)”
Reviews.Author: birtual
Reviews.Content: new, nice and clean. both room and bathroom seemed recently renewed, so they looked very good and everything was clean, very clean. shower was great, but no space to put anything else than the toothbrush in the bathroom. the room was also small, and the bed, but comfortable. no wardrobe, just a hanger and a very small shelf. which is OK if you go for 1 night or 2. super clean! thats the most imporatnt for me to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: traveller_chica01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 5 min walk from Kings X, but it's not a nice neighborhood & as a single woman I felt a bit worried. The room was only as big as a single bed. My big issue was my room was in the basement and through a maize to get there! I wondered what would possibly happen if there was a fire.... didn't feel safe. The bed was comfortable & the room was dark. I paid 50pounds a night. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, Clean, good enough”
Reviews.Author: epcnd
Reviews.Content: The rooms and bathroom are very small, the stairs and halllway are narrow, but they keep everything clean. When I say its small, I mean your bed is four steps from the door and takes up most of the room (single bed), however twin and double rooms are larger. For the price and location its a decent deal, we stayed for four days and had no complaints, I wouldn't mind staying there again. Btw they have a luggage room but its not locked.

Reviews.Title: “very small but spotlessly clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: pildyboys
Reviews.Content: Cheap price, great location, friendly staff, but very small rooms. No coffee facilities in the room not even a glass to drink your own drinks with. The rooms are basic but not finished off very well, however spotlessly clean, showers hot and lots of power. Bed comfortable, staff friendly and helpful. No breakfast facilities. I would use this hotel again if i could not get in at the other hotel i stayed in during november 2008. as this much better for a fiver more. and i got breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lars_VK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our yearly stay in London. We're independent, 'free' travellers who most of the time use hostels, all we need is a comfortable bed, clean sheets and a decent bathroom. And that's what Wardonia hotel is offering, and how! We payed 32 GBP per person per night (you will pay the same price in the youthhostels of London with no comfort at all) and what we got was a small (check the website) but incredibly clean an tidy room, with great beds. Cleaned every day (fresh towels). The bathroom is designed in the 'italian way', meaning that there is no seperate shower cabin, but a hole in the floor to let the water go. Of course there's a shower curtain and (which is the most important), the shower is really good. The location, near the station is brilliant, but you here almost nothing in the streets. Slept as a rose. The room even has a TV (very rare for our way of travelling) with digital channels, so we could watch 'Top gear' all evening long! I really appreciated their website where they are really honest about the kind of hotel they are running: small but clean and comfortable rooms without breakfast. So, if you're looking for a comfortable stay, for a low price on a top location in London, I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “A bed, 4 walls & a bathroom--nothing more. Just fine.”
Reviews.Author: yellowsteph
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a place to stay for the two days we were in London. London is an expensive place, so we just wanted a cheap place to stay, but nothing gross & dingy. And that's what we found at the Wardonia Hotel! THE HOTEL: The staff wasn't anything particularly "awesome" or "wow"ish, but they seemed pleasant enough. We never really heard our next door neighbors, but we did hear people walking around in the room above us. Nothing bad, at all. There is not an elevator at this hotel, that we know of. (-)There is no breakfast available, but there is a small convenient store/post office about a block from the hotel, where we bought fruit and croissants. LOCATION: The hotel is a stone's throw from King's Cross/St. Pancras Station. This means it is very close to the underground and train station where the chunnel arrives/departs . I was told that this area isn't the best neighborhood, but I never really felt threatened or uneasy. The hotel is not "centrally located," but I felt it was near enough to everything we needed to see. Getting to Kensington did take a little while, though. THE ROOM: We were given a small room with a double bed, two towels, and a small TV. The room had a very small bathroom: toilet, sink, shower. We had a very nice, tall, screen-less window, which offered a nice breese when opened. This room might get very hot in the summer, but we were there in September, so it was just fine! There was *just* enough room for the two of us and our two suitcases. This was all we needed, because we were out seeing sights all day, so we were only in our room sleeping at night. In conclusion: This hotel is cheap, clean, small room, but nearby train/underground stations.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjgalway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wardonia as its very close to St. Pancras station. There are a lot of substandard hotels I think, but the Wardonia certainly is not. The rooms are very small, but the hotels website shows you exactly what dimensions your room and indeed you bed and bathroom are going to be so nobody should complain about the size. Its clean and in a good location and thats all you really need. Very easy access to anywhere in Greater London due to its proximity to Kings Cross and St. Pancras stations. Its also a lot cheaper than many alternatives for such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmcpb
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much, as I only paid £80. I didn't expect anything other than a small room with no frills. But this is NOT a good hotel. The room was dirty, as were the sheets, as were the towels, and it's TINY. The bathroom was a wet room that didn't drain properly. On the plus side, the location for Eurostar is great, but I would pick a different hotel on this street.

Reviews.Title: “Very practical and good value”
Reviews.Author: DrCrazyA
Reviews.Content: Since the Regent Palace closed, I have been looking for a centrally located, inexpensive hotel to park myself during my annual visit to London. The Wardonia is literally one block away from the Kings Cross St Pancras station and ideal for hopping onto the Eurostar or the underground. The rooms are very clean. The building itself is old but adequately maintained. There is no air conditioning but good heating. If you have never stayed in Europe, be forewarned that the rooms are tiny! If you have anything larger than a duffel bag or a carry-on rolling luggage you will not be able to keep it lying open in the room because there is not enough space. My friend and I had two rolling carry-on suitcases and we had to keep them closed except to take stuff out of them. This hotel is simply a place to sleep and shower and is ideal if you do not plan to spend a lot of time in your hotel room. If you plan to do lot of shopping or stay in London for a long period of time you may want to consider a larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny but clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: barbsliny
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Wardonia through Venere.com and searched sites until I found a code for a 4% discount. Our rate was 60 GBP a night before the discount. The room was....small. Very small. There was room for the double bed, the TV, the tiny nightstand, our suitcase (squished a bit) and that's it. The bathroom had room for the toilet, sink, and shower...though the shower area was very small (and since there is no difference between the shower floor and the rest of the bathroom floor, everything gets wet anyway. The windows open, but had no screens, so we had a few flies join us every night. We were on the 4th floor, which was a fun hike every night...particularly when carrying luggage. But...the room was clean. Our bed was made daily (though the sheets weren't changed), and we had fresh folded towels every day. There was no phone in the room, but I was able to "borrow" a wireless internet signal by putting my ipod right up against the window...which was good enough to check my email. The bed wasn't the MOST comfortable I ever slept in, but it was good enough for 5 nights. Overall, it was a clean room, but certainly not luxiorious. We found the Kings Cross area to be a great location...not nearly as "dodgy" as others had described. It was very conveniently located, as it is on so many of the Underground's lines.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, but central and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Gusse
Reviews.Content: We wanted: -a cheap clean single room with en-suite bathroom -central location to tubes, without noisy surroundings, in a safe area We got: -a cheap clean single room with en-suite bathroom -central location to tubes, without noisy surroundings, in a safe area -friendly staff -maid every day(only a clean towel the days we slept long:-) We just wanted a place to sleep, close to a central tube-station, and we got it. Yes, it's tiny, and yes, it's no breakfast. But it's what we knew when we booked! London is expensive, and most budget hotels is worse than this, I think. I'll go back later for only 40£ per night for a single room (and private tiny bathroom) that we paid! But next time I will use a smaller suitcase:-)

Reviews.Title: “just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: ajjarm
Reviews.Content: good location, near St. Pancras/Kings Cross train stations. Just what we expected: a no frills room. Clean, small, good for the one night we stayed. Web site accurately depicts hotel/rooms. Would advise for a budget hotel for one to two persons. Would be tough with lots of luggage or if traveling with small children, as it is quite small with no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Small, very small”
Reviews.Author: potterh
Reviews.Content: given the amount we paid (80 pounds per night), i know i shouldn't be expecting much... however, i was a bit disappointed with the hotel. the room was TINY. we had a triple room with private bathroom. we barely had enough room to fit in our luggages. no A/C in the room, which was okay because it was quite cool when we stayed there (but it might be a problem in the summer). no lift so we had to carry our luggages 3 flights of stairs. there was no closet in the room so we had nowhere to hang our clothes. the bathroom was a nightmare! it was small. the worst was there was NOTHING to divide the shower and the rest of the bathroom. so after shower, the entire floor was wet. there was no shelf, no hook, NOTHING, to hang our towels and clothes, which was extremely inconvenient. afterall, the location was convenient - only a 4 min walk to King Cross station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a cheap weekend break near attractions”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowKauri
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on reviews from TripAdvisor and were pleased we did. It is more of a glorified youth hostel, in that it doesn't offer breakfast, nor does it have tea & coffee facilities in the room. However, we had a comfy double bed in a triple room (the other bed made a good storage space), and the shower was good, although of course the water dribbled out near the toilet. One thing that other hotels should note: this place had the full Freeview channels, the ones you get on your digibox at home in the UK- so many hotels haven't caught up on this yet. As promised by reviews, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was clean, and the location was extremely convenient for many things. They have a luggage storage room which was helpful for our last day as we still had time to do stuff. However, the security didn't seem very London-ready- you just put your stuff in the room and it's not locked. It doesn't say so on their website, but they do offer irons and hairdryers to those who need them. Their website is otherwise great, as it tells you very explicitly what the rooms are like.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: wordsandpictures
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, mainly because the hotel is cheap and close to St. Pancras. The rooms are indeed very small, but clean. Don't expect anything fancy: everything is adequate but there's no attention to detail whatsoever (the view from our window was a brick wall, for example). A good choice if you're on a tight budget - I guess it's good value for London. Otherwise not very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Bleh”
Reviews.Author: bluedahlia
Reviews.Content: I understand that this is a very cheap hotel for London standards, but the room was way too small ( I could hardly fit my luggage in and myself), and the bathroom of course, was tiny.
